content:
Hello!

I am just wondering are there anybody here with experience in delivering SMART on FHIR application with EPIC Hyperspace?
I am working on such a task right now. I can't get what is the version for the EPIC Hyperspace embedded browser.
Based on the EPIC docs it is IE11. However, I heard that although it is IE11 it always uses IE10 compatibility mode.

Could you please help me?

Hey Ilya, I don't have a lot of experience delivering SMART apps embedded in Hyperspace; however, I did want to point you to this resource and documentation, from: https://open.epic.com/launchpad/OAuth2Sso

If you are writing a web-based application that you intend to embed in Epic, you may find that your application may require minor modifications. We offer a simple testing harness to help you validate that your web application is compatible with the embeddable web application viewer. As embedding your application in Hyperspace may not behave the same as presenting it in a browser, ensure that your app works with the testing harness and that you can run multiple instances of the app at the same time within the same session.

The "simple testing harness" is a windows executable that recreates the Hyperspace embedded browser and is specifically provided to help developers in your scenario.

Hi, @Isaac Vetter

Thank you very much! It seems that it helps a lot. I will test my app on this browser!
